chapter.title: Setting Site-Specific Hooks
chapter.para:
The LiveJournal code provides a number of hooks, which you can use to alter or extend the functionality of the code, tailored for your own site. You're free to implement as few or as many as you want.
If there's a hook you want but don't see, let us know and we'll be more than happy to add it in.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: One of the reasons for implementing hooks on LiveJournal came from a need to make distinctions between account status types, without leaving a lot of kludge in the code base, and without having to write extensive code libraries in the ljcom CVS repository.

section.title: Writing Hooks
section.para: Hooks are written in cgi-bin/ljconfig.pl, by using the sub LJ::register_hook().
